deck

Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • deck.Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists in handling a set of questions with their answers in one object called a Deck. It behaves as a linked list between elements called DeckEle.
    Author:
    Patrick Created by Patrick Finnerty, this program allows for the creation of quiz for (but not restricted to) learning purposes.     See Also:
    DeckEle, Question

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addQuestion(Question q)
      Adds the question given as parameter at the end of the list
      java.util.ArrayList<Question> getAllQuestions()
      Gives an ArrayList containing all the different questions contained by the deck.
      Question getCurrentQuestion()
      Gives the question of the current (ie root) element of the list.
      DeckEle getRoot()
      Gives the root element of the deck
      Question next()
      Moves the root to the next element.
      boolean noQuestionLeft()
      Indicates if there are questions left in the deck, that is if the next DeckEle is not null.
      int resetSuccess()
      Sets all the success counter of all the questions in the deck to 0 If the root element is null, process stops and returns 1.
      void setRoot(DeckEle deckEle)
      Allows to set the root of the deck to a certain deckElement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck()
        Empty Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • noQuestionLeft

        public boolean noQuestionLeft()
        Indicates if there are questions left in the deck, that is if the next DeckEle is not null.
        Returns:
        true if root is the last element, false otherwise.

      • addQuestion

        public void addQuestion(Question q)
        Adds the question given as parameter at the end of the list
        Parameters:
        q - the question to be added

      • getAllQuestions

        public java.util.ArrayList<Question> getAllQuestions()
        Gives an ArrayList containing all the different questions contained by the deck. Multiple occurrences of a question in a deck will not appear in the list returned The list will not contain null questions. But a question might have been poorly initialised properly.
        Returns:
        the list of all different questions contained in the deck.

      • next

        public Question next()
        Moves the root to the next element. The current root is therefore lost after this operation.
        Returns:
        the question of the next element (the next element being the new root).

      • getCurrentQuestion

        public Question getCurrentQuestion()
        Gives the question of the current (ie root) element of the list.
        Returns:

      • resetSuccess

        public int resetSuccess()
        Sets all the success counter of all the questions in the deck to 0 If the root element is null, process stops and returns 1. If a null pointerExcpetion is encountered (poorly initialised question), returns 2. If no problem encountered, returns 0.
        Returns:

      • setRoot

        public void setRoot(DeckEle deckEle)
        Allows to set the root of the deck to a certain deckElement. It also updates the value of last to the last non null next DeckEle.
        Parameters:
        deckEle - the new root

      • getRoot

        public DeckEle getRoot()
        Gives the root element of the deck
        Returns:
        root (ie current DeckEle.
        See Also:
        to get the current question directly
